headline: Best Hamburger Ever
description: The best burger recipe you'll make all summer! These juicy hamburgers are bursting with flavor thanks to onion, cheese, herbs, and lots of seasonings.

video.description: See how to make tasty burgers loaded with good stuff.
video.name: Best Hamburger Ever

name: Best Hamburger Ever
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup shredded Colby Jack or Cheddar cheese
1 (1 ounce) envelope dry onion soup mix

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate.

Meanwhile, combine ground beef, onion, cheese, egg, onion soup mix, minced garlic, garlic powder, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, parsley, basil, oregano, rosemary, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Use your hands to form the mixture into 4 patties.

Cook patties on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: This was the best burger I've made! It has so much flavor and was not dry at all! Will make again for sure.
wow
I made my own hamburger buns & these HAMBURGERS- Just Fabulous Thank You. They are now my go to Hamburgers- Loved Them. Cheers Denise- Brisbane Qld
Not too sure how this is the best. I made it per instructions. I cant stand meatloaf and this is just like meatloaf.
My Susanne made sliders from this recipe and served them on Hawaiian rolls. OMG! Best ever is not an overstatement! Truly fantastic!

I don't do the soy sauce (thought it would be too salty), I do just the soup mix and an egg. So good. I would suggest not adding anything with additional salt. The soup mix is already salty, adding anything else would be too much imo. I've also done cubed cheese.
Beautiful dish
High in saturated fat and too much salt!
Delicious, I didn't add any herbs, but I did use ranch seasoning. My kids love it!
This is pretty much how I have been making hamburgers for the past 25 years. Except I don't use the soup mix. I do add pre-cooked bacon though!
Awesome 👌

I made this recipe last night, exactly as written and we found lt to be "The Best Hamburger Ever"!! I don't like the taste of salt and I didn't find it to be too salty at all. I will make this recipe again next time I make burgers.
Didn’t add the salt & pepper. Burger was still filled with an explosion of flavor & firm.

I was a decent burger, not great. After reading all the reviews I cut back on the onion soup mix. That helped with the salt. My wife said too many herbs. Without reading the reviews, she said it was like a meatloaf burger, lol. Way more effort & ingredients than needed. I will go back to my stand by of Montreal Steak season & pepper & sometimes dried onions. I may add the egg to my version so they are not dry. Much easier…

No changes. Should be called meatloaf not hamburger and it is way too salty, OK I guess but no one finished theirs, always a bad sign in my house. We do prefer med- rare burgers and this could not be cooked rare. Also got complaints about the crunchy onion bits. Back to basics for us.

When you use the handle "best ever" it had better be. Unfortunatelly I made this as written on very good hard rolls with fresh lettuce & tomato. First off the rosemary is too noticeable and adds a perfume I don't care for in a burger. I'd suggest leaving that out, and suspect if I did so the oregano would be nezt to remove, then basil, then cutting the garlic in half. and skipping the onion soup. The star of a burger at some point has to be the MEAT.
Change the name to "Best Meatloaf Patties" and it would be perfect. All of the ingredients changes it to meatloaf and not hamburger.
I made these burgers for my fraternity brothers and they won't let me stop making them! The recipe is fantastic.
I did not make any changes, but I did use red onion and sweet onion.
Too much like meatloaf.
I caramalized the onions before mixing together. The buns are sour dough.

I have been using this recipe for well over a decade! the only changes i have made was to remove the rosemary altogether and use half a package of knorr french onion soup mix.

i have found if you use otherbrands for the soupmix it is too salty even at half a package. but knorr seems to be just right!

Best hamburgers I have ever made. Only mods I’ve made is I do half and half 80%/90%, I don’t add the onion soup packet as it doesn’t need it and I do about half the amount of onion. Every member of my family keeps hounding me for the burger recipe :D 
Careful on grills as the cheese makes them a little more greasy so grease fires are more likely.

Made it without the onion soup, subbed 1 t of onion powder. also grated some butter into the mix.
Turned out the best burger I've made in years! My housemates agree!
These were too “busy” way too many things going on. Definitely not a classic burger recipe.

These were delicious! Based on past history, I only added 1/2 of the onion soup mix, not the entire envelope. other than that, spot on. I will be gong to this recipe for burgers on the grill from now on.

These were the hit of my burger selection we grilled for a large number of people. So much so that they all disappeared before even a third of the others were touched. Juicy, flavorful and simple to prepare. Spice them up if you want but I don't think you'll have to from the reaction of the crowd. Well done!

I followed the recipe fairly closely. I didn't have any onion soup though, and I didn't add cheese because some people don't like it. With that said, my guests enjoyed them, but I felt like it had too much oregano. I'll reduce that amount next time. I used 93/7% beef/fat and low sodium soy sauce. I definitely will try these again with some adjustments.

Absolutely delicious. I didn't have fresh onion so used powdered instead. I also had a can of sliced mushrooms which I added. I think next time I will omit those. It will be in my "book" whenever we want hamburgers. They are good enough to serve casual company as well.
These burgers are excellent
Recipe looks nice. I got 4 big buns ready.
One of our favorite ways to make burgers when I’m feeling “adventurous” (wanting something a little more than ground beef and a little seasoning).
The fan bam absolutely loved these burgers, I’m not a mince lover but with all these ingredients added in I could only just taste the mince. Will definitely make these again thank you for the recipe.
Sooo delicious. I’ve made this recipe three times now. It’s a big family hit!
These are the best burgers. The whole family loves them
Easy to make and great taste

I made a few changes based on others reviews. First I didn't have basil, I added minced garlic, measured the cheese with my heart, and added about 1/4 a cup of bread crumbs and finally took the onion mix down to a half a package. They were delicious, not one complaint from any of my kids and my 2 year old even ate all of hers as well. Will definitely make again maybe with some bacon in the mix!
I made it without the soup mix because I knew it would make it salty. Turned out just great.
This burger was good! It was so spicy (not hot). I feel like it needed some fruit to deflect from the explosion of spices in your mouth. Would maybe try it again.

This was the best burger recipe I have ever followed! Only reason I voted it 4 stars is because of the modifications I made. I do think you should follow what I did though ‘cause it was DELICIOUS! I doubled the recipe and used 1 pound each of ground pork, hot Italian sausage, and ground beef. I also only used one packet of onion soup mix because I was concerned about the level of salt. I did not add any salt or pepper. The burgers turned out absolutely perfect. I hate bread crumbs so I was SUPER satisfied with this recipe!
This was the best tasting hamburger I have ever made. Received several complements on their taste.
This was the best tasting hamburger I have ever made. Received several complements on their taste.
Love this recipe, seems to be a bit too wet, so I put less liquids.
This was a really good recipe. My hubby and my son loved it!

Always trying to upgrade my hamburgers. I came across this one. It was delicious! My husband went on and on about it, and when he does I know it's good. I did add 1 tsp of bbq sauce just because I have to other burgers I've made. It's a keeper in my house.
I love this recipe! I use it in my Hamburger tomato vegetable soup. Of course, I leave out the cheese, but it's delicious in the soup! It's my go-to.
I substituted the soy and Worcestershire for Country Bob’s. Delicious burgers that got rave reviews at my cookout. One of the attendees thought they were sausage burgers.

These were juicy thick burgers. I added 1 lb of ground turkey breast plus 1 lb of ground chuck. I did not add any salt or pepper. All other ingredients were used as stated. I will make these again. Very delicious. I added all seasoning to my meat about 4 hours before I cooked them on George Foreman grill. Really able to get flavors through meat. Very delicious. My family enjoyed them.
Great burger. My son loved it. We did not add the onion soup or Worcestershire sauce. We’ll definitely make it again soon.

Gotta say........pretty darn good burger! Can’t agree with reviews saying that it tastes like meatloaf although I did not include onion soup seasoning. I like my burgers well done so I grilled 7 minutes one side and 6 on the other ( about 3/4 inch thick) and they game out juicy! Recipe is a keeper for me.
Delicious
I Did not have the onion soup and soy sauce. It was still delicious!
Will definitely make again
Very tasty burger.
AMAZING BURGERS
My husband is a hamburger connoisseur and he loved it. I had meat left and he cooked it and took it to work for lunch the next day
Way too salty, too much garlic. Pass on this one.
SO good!! I may add a little breadcrumbs next time but do delicious

I left out the onion soup mix and the rosemary. I didn’t have either of those but I wouldn’t have added them anyway (too much salt...and rosemary?!? Ew).. They were super yummy. Added a pinch of salt and pepper, Colby jack cheese, lettuce, tomato, lemon tarragon mustard and a simple white bun. De-lish!
Amazing burger! We served 15 people and everyone was asking for the recipe. Highly recommend!
I also added the Golden corral meatloaf seasoning instead of using the onion packet which I think tastes better
Loved it. Will make again
I personally don't prefer the rosemary, basil, parsley, or oregano. But without it, I ended up liking it. Good job.
Made the recipe just like it's listed. Not too salty at all. VERY good!!! Making again tonight.

Everyone said that these were the best burgers that they had ever had. I made 4x's what the recipe called for- and it made 16 HUGE burgers....the burgers were actually too big for most to finish. Overall everyone loved this Gluten free burger

I made no changes, except to halve the recipe and ended up with a pair of 10oz burgers.....and the flavor was just outstanding.

LOVE THEM!
Thanks !
Probably the best burger I've ever had. Didnt have soy sauce and substituted a ranch packet for the onion packet.

My husband and I both agree that this is the best burger we have ever eaten. They were so very juicy and flavorful. We had an unexpected storm so I had to cook them on stove top. I did make two small changes. After adding the fresh garlic I decided to leave out the garlic powder. I also used only half the package of onion soup mix as we are watching our salt intake. We will be making these again very soon. We also plan on having them the next time our kids visit.
Wow !truly best burgers ever

Best burgers ever! 
I cooked these recently at a BBQ. Everyone loved them.
I have made this several times and tried it on Chicken breast minus the egg and its by far the best we have ever had.
Loved them!!!
Very nice to make and fast now to taste it

How do I keep it from falling apart when I try flipping it on a open flame grill?

I agree. Great great taste. Will have to work on the flip.

I strongly disagree about it tasting like meatloaf. Never any doubt. A great hamburger.
We made exactly as the recipe. It was excellent, we wouldn’t make any changes. This is a keeper.
I don't have a grille, so this recipe is also good for the stove. I used half of the soup packet just because it seemed like a lot of powder, served with spicy aioli.
My favorite burger recipe. Everyone raves about them!
I suggest mincing the garlic and onion very fine.
I suggest mincing the garlic and onion very fine.

Made this as is first go around, was tasty, didn’t care too much for the rosemary, made again today, made couple changes, did half ground beef half ground pork, deleted the rosemary and added a tsp of red pepper flakes .. took it to a five star.. was delicious with a nice amount of kick

I'll take the "tasteless bread crumbs" if it means these burgers will stick together. They fell apart at the turn. Flavor is okay. We'll use the crumbles in tacos or wraps or something. Won't make it again.
Followed exact recipe except for rosemary (did not have). Best burger ever !!

I liked this take on a burger. I made as per recipe first time and found too much salt as Nick mentioned so I cut back to half a pack and it worked great. Only made one mod since to allow for a guest who was not a crazy garlic person like my wife and I. Just trimmed the powder and minced garlic back and found it was a hit for them as well. I think it's always in the chefs hands to tweak as required

I thought this hamburger recipe was very good with a few tweaks. I noticed that some said it was too salty so I decided to forgo the onion soup mix altogether, plus it didn't hurt that I actually didn't have any! Lol.. instead of using onion I tried using a finely chopped shallot and two teaspoons of onion powder. I also decided that the rosemary didn't have any business being in my burger sooo... none of that either. I added just a little bit of salt and some pepper . Also, decided to put the burgers on brioche buns and boy were they good! I thought they were super easy and delicious.
Made only one change. Put some ranch dressing mix in this also. All Burgers were quickly consumed. Oh so juicy and good.

Great recipe and yes, cooking on the grill is essential. Left out the onion soup mix and put in minced onion instead. Also left out rosemary because it’s a wacky ingredient for a burger. PRO TIP: make the burgers early in the day and let them hang out in the fridge before cooking for dinner. The flavors blend better!
My wife hates rosemary so I dropped that. This is legitimately the best burger I’ve ever had!
Excellent burger. The only change I made was add some breadcrumbs and omit onion soup mix.
I agree with some others , its too salty. Half the ingredients with much less onion soup mix or bread crumbs is what I will try next time.
I would not recommend this recipe to anyone under any circumstances. Sorry to whom evers recipe this but I could not stomach this " hamburger ".
Used the garlic powder, but not the garlic. Wife does not care for a lot of garlic. The burger was great, everyone thought so.

Haven't made burgers for a long time. I added the herbs but reduced each by half and it still added deliciousness. I used Havarti since I didn't have Colby Jack. The soy sauce and Worcestershire added flavor too.
I didn't have any Worcestershire so I used A1 instead. I would not call this the best burger but it is pretty good. I think if I cut back on the rosemary and garlic it would be better.

I wouldn't say the "best" ever, but it is really really good. I don't know why people complained about the saltiness or the "meatloaf" taste. First, you control the salt...so if you dumped a bunch of salt in after adding all the ingredients, then this must be your first time cooking. AND if you think this tastes like meatloaf, you don't know how to make a meatloaf. Anyway, it is flavorful and grills up nicely (I don't think it would pan fry as well).

Very good , added to much rosemary so a little strong, I would do 2 garlic cloves as well
But I do have to say it was juicy and tasty
Great burger
Yum! This was such a good recipe! I used less garlic salt and more rosemary.
Very flavorful.
Tasted like a meatloaf sandwich. Wasn't easy to grill. Fell apart easily. Won't make this one again.
